Sentencas: A general thermodynamic model has shown that combined fuel cell cycles may reach an electric-efficiency of more than 80%.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: This value is one of the targets of the Department of Energy (DOE) solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine (SOFC-GT) program.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The combination of a SOFC and GT connects the air flow of the heat engine and the cell cooling.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The principle strategy in order to reach high electrical-efficiencies is to avoid a high excess air for the cell cooling and heat losses.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: Simple combined SOFC-GT cycles show an efficiency between 60 and 72%.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The combination of the SOFC and the GT can be done by using an external cooling or by dividing the stack into multiple substacks with a GT behind each sub-stack as the necessary heat sink.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The heat exchangers (HEXs) of a system with an external cooling have the benefit of a pressurization on both sides and therefore, have a high heat exchange coefficient.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The pressurization on both sides delivers a low stress to the HEX material.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The combination of both principles leads to a reheat (RH)-SOFC-GT cycle that can be improved by a steam turbine (ST) cycle.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The first results of a study of such a RH-SOFC-GT-ST cycle indicate that a cycle design with an efficiency of more than 80% is possible and confirm the predictions by the theoretical thermodynamic model mentioned above.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The extremely short heat-up time of a thin tubular SOFC and the market entrance of the micro-turbines give the option of using these SOFC-GT designs for mobile applications.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The possible use of hydrocarbons such as diesel oil is an important benefit of the SOFC.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The micro-turbine and the SOFC stack will be matched depending on the start-up requirements of the mobile system.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The minimization of the volume needed is a key issue.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The efficiency of small GTs is lower than the efficiency of large GTs due to the influence of the leakage within the stages of GTs increasing with a decreasing size of the GT.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: Thus, the SOFC module pressure must be lower than in larger stationary SOFC-GT systems.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: This leads to an electrical-efficiency of 45% of a cycle used as a basis for a design study.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: The result of the design study is that the space available in a mid-class car allows the placement of such a system, including space reserves.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems

Sentencas: A further improvement of the system might allow an electrical-efficiency of about 55%.
Titulo: The design of stationary and mobile solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine systems
